cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read. If the input equation results in an empty set of input strings (num_inputs is 0) but a non-empty set of output labels (num_labels is greater than 0), the final loop attempts to access (*input_label_counts)[0]. Since input_label_counts is resized to num_inputs (which is 0), this access is an out-of-bounds read on an empty vector, leading to undefined behavior.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, incorrect program behavior, or exposure of sensitive information.
explanation: The code is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read. If the parsed equation results in an empty input_str, num_inputs will be 0. Consequently, input_label_counts will be resized to 0. Later, in the loop mapping labels to DimensionType, the expression (*input_label_counts)[0][label] is evaluated. Accessing index 0 on an empty input_label_counts vector constitutes an out-of-bounds read, which can lead to a crash or undefined behavior.
